str2: Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Accusative Masculine Plural
Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To know beforehand, foreknow. From pro and ginosko; to know beforehand, i.e. Foresee.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To foreordain, predetermine, mark out beforehand. From pro and horizo; to limit in advance, i.e. predetermine.
Similar, conformed to. From sun and morphe; jointly formed, i.e. similar.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
An image, likeness, bust. From eiko; a likeness, i.e. statue, profile, or representation, resemblance.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
A son, descendent. Apparently a primary word; a 'son', used very widely of immediate, remote or figuratively, kinship.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
First-born, eldest. From protos and the alternate of tikto; first-born.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
A brother, member of the same religious community, especially a fellow-Christian. A brother near or remote.
